challenges.question: What is the highest mountain peak in the world?
explanation: Mount Everest is located in the Mahalangur Himal sub-range of the Himalayas, on the border between Nepal and Tibet, China. It is the highest mountain peak in the world, reaching an elevation of 8,848 meters (29,029 ft) above sea level.
challenges.hint: It is located in Nepal

challenges.question: How many countries are in the Himalayas?
explanation: The Himalayas are located in five countries: Bhutan, China, India, Nepal and Pakistan. These five countries are home to more than one-third of the world’s population and are home to numerous cultures, religions, languages and a rich biodiversity.
challenges.hint: The countries are Bhutan, China, India, Nepal and Pakistan

challenges.question: What is the deepest valley in the Himalayas?
explanation: Kosi Valley is a deep and rugged valley in the Himalayas, located in the Indian state of Uttarakhand. It is the deepest valley in the Himalayas, with a depth of 6,000 metres (19,685 ft).
challenges.hint: It is located in India

challenges.question: What is the longest river that originates in the Himalayas?
explanation: The Brahmaputra river is the longest river that originates in the Himalayas. It is 2,880 kilometers (1,790 mi) long and flows through China, India, and Bangladesh.
challenges.hint: It flows through India, Bangladesh and China

challenges.question: What is the oldest mountain range in India?
explanation: The Himalayan Range is the oldest mountain range in India and is located in the northern part of the country. It stretches from the Indus River in the west to the Brahmaputra River in the east and is home to the world’s highest peak, Mount Everest.
challenges.hint: It is located in the northern part of India

challenges.question: What is the most famous lake in the Himalayas?
explanation: Manasarovar Lake is the most famous lake in the Himalayas, located in the Indian state of Uttarakhand. It is a sacred lake for Hindus and Buddhists, and is the source of four major rivers: the Indus, the Sutlej, the Brahmaputra and the Karnali.
challenges.hint: It is located in India

challenges.question: What is the highest pass in the Himalayas?
explanation: Khardung La Pass is the highest pass in the Himalayas, located between India and China. It is located at an elevation of 5,359 meters (17,582 ft) above sea level and is the highest motorable pass in the world.
challenges.hint: It is located between India and China

challenges.question: What is the name of the oldest human inhabitant of the Himalayas?
explanation: Ramkumar is the name of the oldest human inhabitant of the Himalayas. It was discovered in Nepal and is estimated to be around 10,000 years old.
challenges.hint: It was discovered in Nepal

challenges.question: What is the highest railway station in the world?
explanation: Gulmarg Station is the highest railway station in the world, located in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir. It is located at an elevation of 2,743 meters (9,000 ft) above sea level.
challenges.hint: It is located in India

challenges.question: What is the longest glacier in the Himalayas?
explanation: Siachen Glacier is the longest glacier in the Himalayas, located in the Pakistani-administered region of Kashmir. It is 75 kilometers (47 mi) long and is the longest glacier in the Karakoram mountain range.
challenges.hint: It is located in Pakistan

challenges.question: Which type of food is considered a superfood?
explanation: Grains are considered a superfood because they are full of antioxidants, vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
They are also low in calories and fat.
challenges.hint: This type of food is usually ground into flour.

challenges.question: Which food is rich in omega-3 fatty acids?
explanation: Fish is rich in omega-3 fatty acids because it contains high levels of DHA and EPA. These fatty acids are important for healthy brain, heart, and eye development.
Fatty fish like salmon and mackerel are especially high in these healthy fats.
challenges.hint: This type of food is usually eaten raw, but can also be cooked.

challenges.question: Which food is considered a good source of protein?
explanation: Eggs are considered a good source of protein because they are high in essential amino acids and provide all 9 essential amino acids.
One egg contains 6 grams of protein and is a great source of vitamins and minerals.
challenges.hint: This type of food is usually eaten cooked.

challenges.question: Which food is known for its anti-inflammatory properties?
explanation: Berries are known for their anti-inflammatory properties because they are packed with antioxidants and polyphenols.
These compounds help reduce inflammation and protect against oxidative damage.
challenges.hint: This type of food is usually eaten raw.

challenges.question: Which type of food is high in fiber?
explanation: Legumes are high in fiber because they are a great source of both soluble and insoluble fiber.
They are also rich in protein, vitamins, and minerals.
challenges.hint: This type of food is usually eaten cooked.

challenges.question: Which type of food is high in calcium?
explanation: Nuts are high in calcium because they contain high amounts of the mineral.
Almonds, for example, contain about one-quarter of the calcium found in a glass of milk.
challenges.hint: This type of food is usually eaten raw.

challenges.question: Which type of food is rich in iron?
explanation: Legumes are rich in iron because they contain high amounts of the mineral.
Beans, lentils, and soybeans are especially high in iron and are a great source of plant-based protein.
challenges.hint: This type of food is usually eaten cooked, but can also be eaten raw.

challenges.question: What is the oldest subway system in the United States?

challenges.question: What is the oldest restaurant in NYC?

challenges.question: What is the deepest ocean trench in the world?
explanation: The Mariana Trench is the deepest ocean trench in the world, located in the western Pacific Ocean near the Mariana Islands. It has a maximum depth of approximately 11,034 meters (36,201 feet).

challenges.question: What is the second largest ocean in the world?
explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the world's largest and deepest ocean and covers an area of about 106,400,000 square kilometers (41,100,000 square miles). It is located between the Southern Ocean, Asia, Australia, and the Americas.
challenges.hint: It covers an area of about 106,400,000 square kilometers.

challenges.question: How many oceans are there on Earth?
explanation: There are four oceans on Earth: the Atlantic, Pacific, Indian and Arctic Oceans. They cover approximately 71% of the Earth's surface and contain about 97% of the Earth's water.
challenges.hint: The answer is a number.

challenges.question: What is the world's largest ocean animal?
explanation: The blue whale is the largest animal on Earth, growing up to 33 meters (110 feet) in length and weighing up to 173 tonnes (190 tons). It is a mammal that lives in the open ocean and can dive to depths of up to 1,000 meters (3,280 feet).
challenges.hint: It is a mammal.

challenges.question: Which ocean is the saltiest?
explanation: The Atlantic Ocean is the saltiest of the world's oceans, with a salinity of between 33 and 37 parts per thousand. It is located in the Southern Hemisphere, between Africa, Europe, the Southern Ocean, and the Americas.
challenges.hint: It is located in the Southern Hemisphere.

challenges.question: What is the world's largest estuary?
explanation: The Hudson Bay is the largest estuary in the world, located on the east coast of North America. It is approximately 1.2 million square kilometers (463,000 square miles) in size and covers a large portion of northeastern Canada.
challenges.hint: It is located on the east coast of North America.

challenges.question: What is the world's largest coral reef?
explanation: The Great Barrier Reef is the largest coral reef system in the world, located in the Coral Sea off the coast of Australia. It is approximately 2,300 kilometers (1,400 miles) in length and is composed of over 900 individual reefs and thousands of species of plants and animals.
challenges.hint: It is located in the Coral Sea.

challenges.question: What is the world's largest ocean current?
explanation: The Gulf Stream is the world's largest ocean current, located in the Atlantic Ocean. It is a powerful, warm and swift ocean current that originates in the Gulf of Mexico, flows through the Straits of Florida and then up the eastern coast of the United States and Canada before turning east and crossing the Atlantic.
challenges.hint: It is located in the Atlantic Ocean.

challenges.question: How deep can a submarine dive?
explanation: Most modern submarines are capable of diving to depths of up to 2,000 feet (610 meters) below the surface of the ocean. At this depth, the pressure is so great that the hull of the submarine must be extremely strong and reinforced with special high-strength steel.
challenges.hint: It is measured in feet.

challenges.question: What is the world's deadliest ocean animal?
explanation: The stonefish is the world's deadliest ocean animal, with venomous spines on its back that can deliver a powerful and potentially fatal sting. It is found in shallow coastal waters throughout the Indo-Pacific region and is well-camouflaged to blend in with its surroundings.
challenges.hint: It is a fish.

challenges.question: What is the world's most popular tourist destination?

challenges.question: Which city has the most skyscrapers?

challenges.question: What is the longest river in the world?

The Nile is known for its ancient history, as it was home to many civilizations, including ancient Egypt.

challenges.question: What is the largest desert in the world?

challenges.question: What is the hottest place on Earth?

challenges.question: What is the world's oldest city?

challenges.question: What is the world's deepest lake?

challenges.question: Which country has the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites?
explanation: Italy has the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites, with 53 sites in total.
The sites range from cultural to natural, and include the historic cities of Rome and Venice, as well as the Dolomite Mountains and Mount Etna.
challenges.hint: It's in Europe.

challenges.question: What is the oldest World Heritage Site?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: Palmyra is the oldest World Heritage Site, inscribed on the list in 1980. It is located in Syria, and was an important oasis in the ancient world, owing to its strategic location along the Silk Road.
Palmyra is known for its extensive ruins, including the Temple of Bel, which is a major archaeological site.
challenges.hint: It is located in Syria

challenges.question: What is the most visited World Heritage Site?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: The Colosseum is the most visited World Heritage Site. It is located in Italy and is one of the most iconic structures from the Roman Empire. It was built between 70 and 80 AD and could hold between 50,000 and 80,000 spectators.
The Colosseum has become a symbol of Rome, and it is now one of the most popular tourist attractions in the world, with millions of visitors each year.
challenges.hint: It is located in Italy

challenges.question: What is the largest World Heritage Site?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: Yellowstone National Park is the largest World Heritage Site, covering an area of 8,983 square kilometers. It is located in the United States, in the states of Wyoming, Montana, and Idaho.
Yellowstone is one of the most popular national parks in the United States, and it is home to a wide variety of wildlife, including grizzly bears, wolves, bison, and elk.
challenges.hint: It is located in Canada

challenges.question: What is the most unique World Heritage Site?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: The Taj Mahal is the most unique World Heritage Site. It is located in India and is a white marble mausoleum built in the 17th century. It is widely considered to be one of the most beautiful buildings in the world and is a symbol of love.
The Taj Mahal attracts millions of visitors each year, making it one of the most popular tourist attractions in India.
challenges.hint: It is located in India

challenges.question: What is the most endangered World Heritage Site?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: Virunga National Park is the most endangered World Heritage Site. It is located in the Democratic Republic of Congo and is home to some of the world's last remaining mountain gorillas. It is also one of Africa's oldest national parks.
The park is threatened by poaching, illegal mining, and the activities of armed militia, and it has been listed as a World Heritage Site in Danger since 1994.
challenges.hint: It is located in the Democratic Republic of Congo

challenges.question: What is the most recently inscribed World Heritage Site?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: The Forbidden City is the most recently inscribed World Heritage Site. It is located in China and is a palace complex that was the home of emperors of the Ming and Qing dynasties for over 500 years. It is the world's largest palace complex, covering an area of 720,000 square meters.
The Forbidden City is one of the most visited tourist attractions in China, with millions of visitors each year.
challenges.hint: It is located in China

challenges.question: What is the largest World Heritage Site in Asia?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: Angkor Wat is the largest World Heritage Site in Asia. It is located in the modern-day country of Cambodia and was built in the 12th century as a Hindu temple complex. It is now the symbol of Cambodia and is one of the most visited tourist attractions in Southeast Asia.
Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument in the world, covering an area of 162.6 hectares.
challenges.hint: It is located in India

challenges.question: What is the most visited World Heritage Site in South America?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: Machu Picchu is the most visited World Heritage Site in South America. It is located in Peru and is an Incan city that was built in the 15th century. It is one of the most iconic symbols of the Incan Empire and is now one of the most popular tourist attractions in the world.
Machu Picchu attracts more than one million visitors each year, making it the most visited tourist site in Peru.
challenges.hint: It is located in Peru

challenges.question: What is the most visited World Heritage Site in Europe?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: The Colosseum is the most visited World Heritage Site in Europe. It is located in Italy and is one of the most iconic structures from the Roman Empire. It was built between 70 and 80 AD and could hold between 50,000 and 80,000 spectators.
The Colosseum has become a symbol of Rome, and it is now one of the most popular tourist attractions in the world, with millions of visitors each year.
challenges.hint: It is located in Italy

challenges.question: What is the most visited World Heritage Site in Africa?
challenges.topic: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
explanation: The Pyramids of Giza are the most visited World Heritage Site in Africa. They are located in Egypt and are one of the most iconic symbols of Ancient Egypt. The pyramids were built over 4,500 years ago and are believed to have been constructed as tombs for the Pharaohs.
The Pyramids of Giza attract millions of visitors each year, making them one of the most popular tourist destinations in Egypt.
challenges.hint: It is located in Egypt

subject: Fun facts about World Heritage Sites
